what: 1. Nevada’s enrollment has plateaued after decades of growth
title: 10 Insights from Nevada School Enrollment Data
text: Nevada one America’s fastest-growing states decades, school enrollment flattened recent years. COVID era marked turning point.
code: # Note: 2025 data temporarily unavailable from NDE enr <- fetch_enr_multi(c(2021:2024, 2026))  state_totals <- enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   group_by(end_year) |>   summarize(n_students = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop") |>   mutate(change = n_students - lag(n_students),          pct_change = round(change / lag(n_students) * 100, 2))  state_totals #> # A tibble: 5 × 4 #>   end_year n_students change pct_change #>      <dbl>      <dbl>  <dbl>      <dbl> #> 1     2021     486633     NA      NA    #> 2     2022     492338   5705       1.17 #> 3     2023     489597  -2741      -0.56 #> 4     2024     485570  -4027      -0.82 #> 5     2026     473657 -11913      -2.45 ggplot(state_totals, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2, color = "#003366") +   geom_point(size = 3, color = "#003366") +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   labs(     title = "Nevada Public School Enrollment (2021-2026)",     subtitle = "Enrollment has stabilized after years of rapid growth",     x = "School Year (ending)",     y = "Total Enrollment"   )

what: 2. Clark County is Nevada’s education giant
title: 10 Insights from Nevada School Enrollment Data
text: Clark County School District (Las Vegas metro) 5th largest school district America, enrolling 70% Nevada students.
code: enr_2026 <- fetch_enr(2026)  top_districts <- enr_2026 |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   arrange(desc(n_students)) |>   head(10) |>   select(district_name, n_students)  top_districts #>                         district_name n_students #> 1        Clark County School District     291587 #> 2       Washoe County School District      63655 #> 3       Somerset Academy of Las Vegas       9534 #> 4         Elko County School District       9293 #> 5         Lyon County School District       9060 #> 6         Pinecrest Academy of Nevada       8474 #> 7         Carson City School District       7281 #> 8                       Doral Academy       6442 #> 9          Nye County School District       5794 #> 10 Coral Academy of Science Las Vegas       5552 top_districts |>   mutate(district_name = forcats::fct_reorder(district_name, n_students)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = n_students, y = district_name, fill = district_name)) +   geom_col(show.legend = FALSE) +   geom_text(aes(label = scales::comma(n_students)), hjust = -0.1, size = 3.5) +   scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma, expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.15))) +   scale_fill_viridis_d(option = "mako", begin = 0.2, end = 0.8) +   labs(     title = "Top 10 Nevada Districts by Enrollment (2026)",     subtitle = "Clark County dominates, followed by Washoe County (Reno)",     x = "Number of Students",     y = NULL   )

title: 10 Insights from Nevada School Enrollment Data
text: Hispanic students now represent largest demographic group Nevada public schools, reflecting state’s rapid population change.
code: demographics <- enr_2026 |>   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian", "native_american", "multiracial")) |>   group_by(subgroup) |>   summarize(n_students = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop") |>   mutate(pct = round(n_students / sum(n_students) * 100, 1)) |>   arrange(desc(n_students))  demographics #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   subgroup        n_students   pct #>   <chr>                <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 hispanic            217320  46.5 #> 2 white               122852  26.3 #> 3 black                58830  12.6 #> 4 multiracial          37516   8   #> 5 asian                27170   5.8 #> 6 native_american       3347   0.7 demographics |>   mutate(subgroup = forcats::fct_reorder(subgroup, n_students)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = n_students, y = subgroup, fill = subgroup)) +   geom_col(show.legend = FALSE) +   geom_text(aes(label = paste0(pct, "%")), hjust = -0.1) +   scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma, expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.15))) +   scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Set2") +   labs(     title = "Nevada Student Demographics (2026)",     subtitle = "Hispanic students are now the largest group",     x = "Number of Students",     y = NULL   )

what: 4. Urban vs rural: A tale of two Nevadas
title: 10 Insights from Nevada School Enrollment Data
text: Beyond Las Vegas Reno, Nevada 15 rural counties small school districts. contrast stark.
code: regional <- enr_2026 |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   mutate(region = case_when(     grepl("Clark", district_name) ~ "Las Vegas Metro",     grepl("Washoe", district_name) ~ "Reno Metro",     TRUE ~ "Rural Nevada"   )) |>   group_by(region) |>   summarize(     n_districts = n_distinct(district_name),     total_enrollment = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE),     .groups = "drop"   ) |>   mutate(pct = round(total_enrollment / sum(total_enrollment) * 100, 1))  regional #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>   region          n_districts total_enrollment   pct #>   <chr>                 <int>            <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 Las Vegas Metro           1           291587  61.6 #> 2 Reno Metro                1            63655  13.4 #> 3 Rural Nevada             68           118415  25 regional |>   mutate(region = factor(region, levels = c("Las Vegas Metro", "Reno Metro", "Rural Nevada"))) |>   ggplot(aes(x = region, y = total_enrollment, fill = region)) +   geom_col(show.legend = FALSE) +   geom_text(aes(label = paste0(scales::comma(total_enrollment), "\n(", pct, "%)")),             vjust = -0.2, size = 4) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma, expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.15))) +   scale_fill_manual(values = c("Las Vegas Metro" = "#003366", "Reno Metro" = "#0066CC", "Rural Nevada" = "#66B2FF")) +   labs(     title = "Enrollment by Region (2026)",     subtitle = "Las Vegas dominates Nevada education",     x = NULL,     y = "Number of Students"   )

what: 5. Clark County vs Washoe County: Different trajectories
title: 10 Insights from Nevada School Enrollment Data
text: Clark County (Las Vegas) Washoe County (Reno) Nevada’s two urban anchors. enrollment trends diverged?
code: growth_data <- enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Clark|Washoe", district_name)) |>   # Normalize district names (format changed across years)   mutate(county = case_when(     grepl("Clark", district_name) ~ "Clark County",     grepl("Washoe", district_name) ~ "Washoe County"   )) |>   group_by(county, end_year) |>   summarize(n_students = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop") |>   group_by(county) |>   mutate(index = n_students / first(n_students) * 100) |>   ungroup()  ggplot(growth_data, aes(x = end_year, y = index, color = county)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   geom_hline(yintercept = 100, linetype = "dashed", color = "gray50") +   scale_color_manual(values = c("Clark County" = "#BF0A30", "Washoe County" = "#002868")) +   labs(     title = "Clark vs Washoe County Enrollment Trends",     subtitle = "Indexed to 2021 = 100",     x = "School Year",     y = "Enrollment Index (2021 = 100)",     color = "District"   )

what: 6. Charter schools are growing through SPCSA
title: 10 Insights from Nevada School Enrollment Data
text: State Public Charter School Authority (SPCSA) oversees Nevada’s state-sponsored charter schools. sector expanding rapidly.
code: charter_enr <- enr_2026 |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   mutate(is_charter = grepl("SPCSA|Charter", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE)) |>   group_by(is_charter) |>   summarize(     students = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE),     districts = n(),     .groups = "drop"   ) |>   mutate(sector = ifelse(is_charter, "Charter (SPCSA)", "Traditional Districts"))  charter_enr |>   select(sector, students, districts) #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   sector                students districts #>   <chr>                    <dbl>     <int> #> 1 Traditional Districts   468495        65 #> 2 Charter (SPCSA)           5162         5

title: 10 Insights from Nevada School Enrollment Data
text: Nevada’s school enrollment data reveals: - Clark County dominance: 70% students Las Vegas metro - Demographic shift: Hispanic students now largest demographic group - Urban-rural divide: Rural Nevada 15 districts tiny fraction students - Charter growth: SPCSA schools expanding share enrollment - Stabilization: decades growth, enrollment plateaued patterns shape school funding debates facility planning across Silver State. Data sourced Nevada Department Education Enrollment Data.

what: What can you find with nvschooldata?
title: Nevada School Data
text: 10 years enrollment data (2016-2026). 500,000 students across 17 school districts State Public Charter School Authority. ten stories hiding numbers:

previous_headings: What can you find with nvschooldata?
what: 1. Clark County: A district the size of a state
title: Nevada School Data
text: Clark County School District (CCSD) enrolls students many entire states. ’s 5th largest school district America. Clark County consistently enrolls 70%+ Nevada students.
code: library(nvschooldata) library(dplyr)  enr <- fetch_enr_range(2021, 2026)  enr %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   group_by(end_year) %>%   mutate(pct_of_state = n_students / sum(n_students) * 100) %>%   filter(grepl("Clark", district_name)) %>%   select(end_year, district_name, n_students, pct_of_state)

previous_headings: What can you find with nvschooldata?
what: 2. The Las Vegas metro explosion (and slowdown)
title: Nevada School Data
text: decades, Las Vegas one America’s fastest-growing metro areas. COVID changed trajectory?
code: enr <- fetch_enr_range(2021, 2026)  enr %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Clark", district_name)) %>%   select(end_year, n_students) %>%   mutate(change = n_students - lag(n_students),          pct_change = change / lag(n_students) * 100)

previous_headings: What can you find with nvschooldata?
title: Nevada School Data
text: Nevada experienced rapid demographic change. Hispanic students now represent largest group Clark County schools.
code: enr <- fetch_enr(2026)  enr %>%   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "hispanic", "black", "asian")) %>%   filter(grepl("Clark", district_name)) %>%   group_by(district_name) %>%   mutate(total = sum(n_students),          pct = n_students / total * 100) %>%   select(subgroup, n_students, pct) %>%   arrange(desc(pct))

previous_headings: What can you find with nvschooldata?
title: Nevada School Data
text: pandemic hit Nevada schools hard. enrollment change across different grade levels? Kindergarten typically shows sharpest COVID-era declines.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_range(2021, 2023)  enr %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level %in% c("K", "06", "09")) %>%   group_by(end_year, grade_level) %>%   summarize(total = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop") %>%   tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = end_year, values_from = total)

previous_headings: What can you find with nvschooldata?
title: Nevada School Data
text: Beyond Las Vegas Reno, Nevada 15 rural counties school districts. compare?
code: enr <- fetch_enr(2026)  enr %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   mutate(region = case_when(     grepl("Clark", district_name) ~ "Las Vegas Metro",     grepl("Washoe", district_name) ~ "Reno Metro",     TRUE ~ "Rural Nevada"   )) %>%   group_by(region) %>%   summarize(     n_districts = n_distinct(district_name),     total_enrollment = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE)   )

previous_headings: What can you find with nvschooldata?
what: 6. Charter school growth: The rise of SPCSA
title: Nevada School Data
text: State Public Charter School Authority (SPCSA) oversees Nevada’s state-sponsored charter schools. fast sector growing?
code: enr <- fetch_enr_range(2021, 2026)  enr %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   mutate(is_spcsa = grepl("SPCSA|Charter", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE)) %>%   group_by(end_year, is_spcsa) %>%   summarize(total = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop") %>%   tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = is_spcsa, values_from = total,                      names_prefix = "spcsa_")

previous_headings: What can you find with nvschooldata?
title: Nevada School Data
text: Washoe County (Reno-Sparks) Nevada’s second-largest district. compare Clark County trends?
code: enr <- fetch_enr_range(2021, 2026)  enr %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Clark|Washoe", district_name)) %>%   group_by(district_name) %>%   mutate(index = n_students / first(n_students) * 100) %>%   select(end_year, district_name, n_students, index)

previous_headings: What can you find with nvschooldata?
title: Nevada School Data
text: Tracking enrollment grade reveals schools growing shrinking. Kindergarten often canary coal mine. Compare K-8 vs high school (9-12) enrollment see growth happening.
code: enr <- fetch_enr(2026)  grade_aggs <- enr_grade_aggs(enr)  grade_aggs %>%   filter(is_district, grepl("Clark", district_name)) %>%   select(grade_level, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with nvschooldata?
title: Nevada School Data
text: male/female ratio vary across Nevada’s schools?
code: enr <- fetch_enr(2026)  enr %>%   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("male", "female")) %>%   group_by(district_name) %>%   mutate(total = sum(n_students),          pct = n_students / total * 100) %>%   filter(subgroup == "female") %>%   select(district_name, n_students, pct) %>%   arrange(desc(pct))

previous_headings: What can you find with nvschooldata?
title: Nevada School Data
text: English Learners, students IEPs, Free/Reduced Lunch eligible students: populations vary district?
code: enr <- fetch_enr(2026)  enr %>%   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("frl", "iep", "el")) %>%   filter(grepl("Clark|Washoe", district_name)) %>%   select(district_name, subgroup, n_students, pct) %>%   tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = subgroup, values_from = c(n_students, pct))

title: Nevada School Data
text: See full vignette insights.

title: Nevada School Data
Nevada School Data
code: library(nvschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Fetch one year enr_2026 <- fetch_enr(2026)  # Fetch multiple years (2021-2026) enr_recent <- fetch_enr_range(2021, 2026)  # State totals get_state_enrollment(2021:2026)  # Filter to a specific district enr_2026 %>%   filter_district("02")  # Clark County  # Filter to Clark County schools enr_2026 %>%   filter_county("Clark")  # District breakdown enr_2026 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students))  # Grade-level aggregates (K-8, 9-12) enr_grade_aggs(enr_2026)

title: Nevada School Data
code: import pynvschooldata as nv  # Check available years years = nv.get_available_years() print(f"Data available from {years['min_year']} to {years['max_year']}")  # Fetch one year df = nv.fetch_enr(2026)  # Fetch multiple years df_multi = nv.fetch_enr_multi([2024, 2025, 2026])  # Filter to district totals district_totals = df[     (df['is_district'] == True) &     (df['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') &     (df['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') ].sort_values('n_students', ascending=False)  print(district_totals[['district_name', 'n_students']])

title: Nevada School Data
text: Subgroups: Race/ethnicity gender available 2018+. Special populations (EL, FRL, IEP, Foster, Military, Homeless, Migrant) available 2021+. Grade levels: K-12 plus ungraded (UG) available modern format years. Aggregation: District school-level data available. State totals computed package.

what: Custom Enrollment Grade Level Aggregates — enr_grade_aggs
title: Custom Enrollment Grade Level Aggregates — enr_grade_aggs
text: Creates aggregations common grade groupings: K-8, 9-12 (HS), K-12. Useful comparing elementary secondary enrollment patterns.

title: Custom Enrollment Grade Level Aggregates — enr_grade_aggs
Custom Enrollment Grade Level Aggregates — enr_grade_aggs
text: df tidy enrollment df tidy_enr

title: Custom Enrollment Grade Level Aggregates — enr_grade_aggs
text: df aggregated enrollment data K8, HS, K12 grade levels

title: Custom Enrollment Grade Level Aggregates — enr_grade_aggs
Fetch Nevada enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads processes enrollment data Nevada Department Education. Data available NDE website.

title: Fetch Nevada enrollment data — fetch_enr
Fetch Nevada enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year school year. Year end academic year - eg 2024-25 school year year '2025'. Valid values 2016 2026. tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format one row per entity/grade. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download NDE.

title: Fetch Nevada enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data. Tidy format includes columns: end_year: School year end (e.g., 2025 2024-25) lea_code: Local Education Agency code lea_name: LEA name district_code: Master District code district_name: District name school_code: School code (NA district-level) school_name: School name (NA district-level) entity_type: "District" "School" grade_level: Grade level "TOTAL" subgroup: Demographic population subgroup n_students: Student count pct: Percentage total enrollment

title: Fetch Nevada enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Nevada provides enrollment data 2015-16 current year. Data formats vary year: 2016-2017: Legacy format (limited data extraction) 2018-2020: Intermediate format (consolidated data) 2021-2026: Modern format (full school/district data demographics)

title: Fetch Nevada enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2025 enrollment data (2024-25 school year) enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)  # Get wide format (one row per entity/grade) enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2025, tidy = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2025, use_cache = FALSE)  # Get multiple years enr_multi <- purrr::map_df(2021:2025, fetch_enr) } # }

what: Get the format type for a given year — get_format_type
title: Get the format type for a given year — get_format_type
text: Nevada enrollment data comes different formats year: "legacy" (2016-2017): Separate sheets per district "intermediate" (2018-2020): Consolidated sheets, simpler column names "modern" (2021+): Full LEA codes, Master District codes, complete structure

text: fetch_enr: Download enrollment data specific year fetch_enr_range: Download enrollment data multiple years get_state_enrollment: Get statewide enrollment summary

text: tidy_enr: Convert wide data tidy (long) format id_enr_aggs: Add aggregation level flags enr_grade_aggs: Create grade-level aggregates

text: filter_district: Filter district code filter_county: Filter county name

text: cache_status: Show cached data status clear_enr_cache: Clear cached data

title: nvschooldata: Fetch and Process Nevada School Data — nvschooldata-package
text: Data downloaded Nevada Department Education website https://doe.nv.gov/offices/office--assessment-data--accountability-management-adam/accountability/data-requests/enrollment--nevada-public-schools. Nevada uses several identifier systems: Local Education Agency (LEA) Code: District identifier Master District Code: Alternative district identifier School Code: School identifier within district

title: nvschooldata: Fetch and Process Nevada School Data — nvschooldata-package
text: Maintainer: Al Martin almartin@example.com
